page.title: 09The River Derwent
page.content: The part of the river in our Block is the{estuary}which is tidal. This river reputedly the fastest in England rises at Springling Tarn below the Scafell Mountain range at some 3206 feet above sea level and within 30 miles meets the sea at Workington. Where the river and the sea meet, the estuary is in great danger of{silting up}and it is necessary for the Port of Workington Authority to maintain the sea lane to the Prince of Wales Dock by regular dredging. The River Derwent is a famous salmon fishing river and subject to the activities of{poachers who attempt to net, hook and use explosives to catch the salmon. In 1984 over 390 poachers were successfully convicted. In our Block there are three{bridges,}one for the A596 road, the railway and a combined dock railway and foot bridge.
